        Get the length of the nucleotide and quality sequences. Both should be the same length.

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Description copied from interface: FastqRecord
        Get the Id of this FastqRecord. Note: It is possible that this id has multiple "words" with whitespace in between if this record was from a CASAVA 1.8 run. This can cause problems with downstream software if whitespace in ids is not allowed.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Defline
        Specified by:
        getId in interface FastqRecord
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Trace
        Returns:
        This id of this FastqRecord as a String

      • getNucleotideSequence

        public NucleotideSequence getNucleotideSequence()
        Description copied from interface: FastqRecord
        Gets the NucleotideSequence of this record. The nucleotide sequence should be the same length as the QualitySequence returned by FastqRecord.getQualitySequence().
        Specified by:
        getNucleotideSequence in interface FastqRecord
        Specified by:
        getNucleotideSequence in interface Trace
        Returns:
        a NucleotideSequence instance; never null.

      • getQualitySequence

        public QualitySequence getQualitySequence()
        Description copied from interface: FastqRecord
        Gets the QualitySequence of this record. The quality sequence should be the same length as the NucleotideSequence returned by FastqRecord.getNucleotideSequence().
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
        getQualitySequence in interface Trace
        Returns:

      • getAvgQuality

        public OptionalDouble getAvgQuality()
                             throws ArithmeticException
        Description copied from interface: FastqRecord
        Get the average quality score as a double. This calculation only works on a sequence that is not empty.
        Specified by:
        getAvgQuality in interface FastqRecord
        Returns:
        the avg quality score as a double.
        Throws:

        Description copied from interface: FastqRecord

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Description copied from interface: FastqRecord
        Two FastqRecords are equal if and only if they have equal ids, NucleotideSequences and QualitySequences. Any comments returned by FastqRecord.getComment() are ignored for equality testing.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface FastqRecord
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the other object to compare.
        Returns:
        true if the other object is also a FastqRecord and has the same id, nucleotide and quality sequence.
